commit_message:
Revert "fix stable/liberty telemetry integration job"

This reverts commit 6f92fa9144077e9c7c971f3cd1b7be89a222849f.

This commits break the Gnocchi gate:

  http://logs.openstack.org/73/263373/3/gate/gate-ceilometer-dsvm-integration/bfdf38d/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

2016-01-05 23:04:15.961 | The /opt/stack/new/gnocchi project was not found; if this is a gate job, add
2016-01-05 23:04:15.961 | the project to the $PROJECTS variable in the job definition.
2016-01-05 23:04:15.961 | + die 536 'Cloning not allowed in this configuration'

Change-Id: I8558b29c39a0d2f3788c03ddf4bff3f597c9a223

deleted_lines: # Do not include gnocchi in projects as devstack-gate can only handle branches at # global level rather per project. We'll let devstack plugins do proper work export PROJECTS="openstack/aodh"

commit_message:
Define ${name}-auditors in storage/generic.pp

All three storage servers need an auditor, thus it is possible to
reuse the same template for all of them and reducing duplicate code.

Added a new test to ensure auditor services are defined.

Also update notifications to include the replicators as well.

Change-Id: I1fcbf55d1326790b35cd620196ca7e373b40df1a
(cherry picked from commit 7f7e4c5952fe91825b9e0f66bd9f1f133f98c282)

commit_message:
Use local puppet modules in DIB

We already have a local copy of all of the openstack puppet modules,
copy these to the undercloud so DIB doesn't clone them from github.
This should be faster and more reliable.

Change-Id: If87f81cf40a837fa32d280c2169300e097aece3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/29/237929/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # create DIB environment variables for all the puppet modules, $TRIPLEO_ROOT # has all of the openstack modules with the correct HEAD. Set the DIB_REPO* # variables so they are used (and not cloned from github)for PROJDIR in $TRIPLEO_ROOT/puppet-*; do REV=$(git --git-dir=$X/.git rev-parse HEAD) X=${PROJDIR//-/_} PROJ=${X##*/} echo "export DIB_REPOREF_$PROJ=$REV" >> $TRIPLEO_ROOT/puppet.env echo "export DIB_REPOLOCATION_$PROJ=$PROJDIR" >> $TRIPLEO_ROOT/puppet.env# Copy the puppet modules to the undercloud where we are building the images tar -czf - /opt/stack/new/puppet-*/.git | ssh root@$SEED_IP tar -C / -xf -
deleted_lines: if [[ "$PROJ" =~ ^puppet-* ]] ; then # openstack/puppet-nova:master:refs/changes/02/213102/5 -> refs/changes/02/213102/5 export DIB_REPOREF_${PROJ//-/_}=${PROJFULLREF##*:} fi# create DIB environment for puppet variablesfor X in $(env | grep DIB.*puppet); do echo "export $X" >> $TRIPLEO_ROOT/puppet.env

commit_message:
Bump the pacemaker service op_params to 200s for start and stop

Based on observed timeouts during updates bump the stop and start
timeouts for pacemaker service resources (via op_params) to 200.
This is based on the reasoning that the full timeout may be as
long as two elapsed timeout intervals. After an initial timeout,
the sigterm that follows is then allowed another
DefaultTimeoutStopSec seconds. The 200s is produced by allowing
this 2xDefaultTimeoutStopSec (@90s for systemd) and some
scheduling delta. Many thanks to Michele Baldessari.

Closes-Bug: 1531204
Change-Id: If6b43982c958f63bc78ad997400bf1279c23df7e

commit_message:
swiftinit provider check init/systemd file content

Compare contents of the init/systemd file on disk against
swiftinit provider template contents.  If they don't match
then the distro provided init/systemd file has not been replaced.
swiftinit provider will call service enable and write out correct
init/systemd file.

Change-Id: I722f6cfa8c537d62a607880cc37863f2d1139636
(cherry picked from commit f3c1832bbbc3b2e16ffb57f37dc83808724e99cb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/64/263964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Returns service enabled status first checking for init/systemd file # presence then checking if file content matches this provider and not # distro provided. Also on Redhat/Debian checks systemctl status. current_conf = File.read("/etc/systemd/system/#{resource[:pattern]}.service") if !current_conf.eql? systemd_template return :false end current_conf = File.read("/etc/init/#{resource[:pattern]}.conf") if current_conf.eql? upstart_template return :true end
deleted_lines: # Returns service enabled status using systemctl on Redhat/Debian # and using presence of init file on Ubuntu. return :true

commit_message:
Manage swift with swiftinit service provider

The 'swiftinit' provider is a custom provider of the service type
that manages swift services using swift-init.

Use of the swiftinit service provider is optional, the default is
to use service providers specified in params file. This provider
also manages swift services starting at boot by adding or removing
a templated init or services file and making systemctl calls.
See README for more detail.

A wrapper defined type 'swift::service' has been created to simplify
use of the swiftinit provider without adding logic to every class.
this wrapper also aids in input validation and testing of the
swiftinit provider.

Two extra runs of apply_manifest have been added to the
basic_swift_spec acceptance test. The service_provider
is set to "swiftinit".  The first run catches any errors upgrading
to the swiftinit service provider and the second run tests
idempotency.

This patch is an initial step towards using swift-init to manage
multiple swift services out of different configuration files such
as is needed to run a separate replication network.

Change-Id: I2f71c82c7a6c463f8c76a193409c0a17daa15bda
(cherry picked from commit 5a7d18975f891c628cdfce798c5c426046203fcb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/63/263963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Temporarily managed by Puppet until # 931893 is resolved # swift-object-server - SWIFT Object Server # # The swift object server. description "SWIFT Object Server" author "Marc Cluet <marc.cluet@ubuntu.com>" start on runlevel [2345] stop on runlevel [016] pre-start script if [ $(find /etc/swift/object-server/ -type f 2>/dev/null | wc -l) -gt 0 ]; then exec /usr/bin/swift-init object-server start elif [ -f /etc/swift/object-server.conf ]; then exec /usr/bin/swift-init object-server start else exit 1 fi end script post-stop exec /usr/bin/swift-init object-server stop

Automate failover acceptance tests

Partial-bug: #1524772
Change-Id: I91abf769e8a92114185bf6cdc8896d1e72433ef7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/53/260653/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from proboscis import test from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic, SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test import settings @test(groups=['failover_group_1']) class FailoverGroup1(TestBasic): """FailoverGroup1""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=['lock_db_access_from_primary_controller']) def lock_db_access_from_primary_controller(self): """Lock DB access from primary controller for Neutron Scenario: 1. Deploy any environment with 3 controllers and NeutronVLAN 2. Lock DB access from primary controller (emulate non-responsiveness of MySQL from the controller where management VIP located) 3. Verify networks 4. Run OSTF tests """ self.env.revert_snapshot('ready_with_9_slaves') self.show_step(1) data = { 'tenant': 'failovergroup1', 'user': 'failovergroup1', 'password': 'failovergroup1', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings=data ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['compute'], 'slave-05': ['compute'], 'slave-06': ['cinder'], } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(2) p_d_ctrl = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_primary_node( self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[0]) with self.fuel_web.get_ssh_for_node(p_d_ctrl.name) as remote: remote.execute('iptables -I OUTPUT 1 -p tcp --dport 4567 -j DROP') remote.execute('iptables -I INPUT 1 -p tcp --dport 4567 -j DROP') self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot('ready_with_9_slaves') @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=['recovery_neutron_agents_after_restart']) def recovery_neutron_agents_after_restart(self): """Recovery of neutron agents after restart Scenario: 1. Deploy environment with 3 controllers and NeutronTUN or NeutronVLAN, all default storages, 2 compute, 1 cinder node 2. Kill neutron agents at all on one of the controllers. Pacemaker should restart it 3. Verify networks 4. Run OSTF tests """ self.env.revert_snapshot('ready_with_9_slaves') self.show_step(1) data = { 'tenant': 'failovergroup1', 'user': 'failovergroup1', 'password': 'failovergroup1', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings=data ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['compute'], 'slave-05': ['compute'], 'slave-06': ['cinder'], } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(2) p_d_ctrl = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_primary_node( self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[0]) with self.fuel_web.get_ssh_for_node(p_d_ctrl.name) as remote: remote.execute('pkill -9 -f <name_of_neutron_agent>') # TODO KILL neutron agents self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot('recovery_neutron_agents_after_restart') @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=['run_rally_benchmark_neutron']) def run_rally_benchmark_neutron(self): """Run rally banchmark for Neutron Scenario: 1. Deploy any environment with 3 controllers and NeutronVLAN 2. Run rally banchmark to generate same activity on cluster (create-delete instance and volume tests) 3. Force reset of primary controller 4. Verify networks after recovery 5. Run OSTF tests after recovery 6. Verify open connection to the rabbit and lsof for nova pids on controller """ self.env.revert_snapshot('ready_with_9_slaves') self.show_step(1) data = { 'tenant': 'failovergroup1', 'user': 'failovergroup1', 'password': 'failovergroup1', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings=data ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['compute'], 'slave-05': ['compute'], 'slave-06': ['cinder'], } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(2) # TODO self.show_step(3) p_d_ctrl = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_primary_node( self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[0]) self.fuel_web.cold_restart_nodes([p_d_ctrl]) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) # TODO self.env.make_snapshot('run_rally_benchmark_neutron') @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=['kill_mongo_process']) def kill_mongo_processes(self): """Kill mongo processes for Neutron Scenario: 1. Deploy any environment with 3 controllers, 3 mongo, NeutronVLAN 2. Kill mongo processes 3. Verify networks 4. Run OSTF tests Returns: """ self.env.revert_snapshot('ready_with_9_slaves') self.show_step(1) data = { 'ceilometer': True, 'tenant': 'failovergroup1', 'user': 'failovergroup1', 'password': 'failovergroup1', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings=data ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['mongo'], 'slave-05': ['mongo'], 'slave-06': ['mongo'], 'slave-07': ['compute'], 'slave-08': ['cinder'], } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(2) # TODO self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot('kill_mongo_process') @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=['close_connections_for_mongo']) def close_connections_for_mongo(self): """Close connection for Mongo node for Neutron Scenario: 1. Deploy any environment with 3 controllers, 3 mongo, 1 compute, 1 Cinder and NeutronTUN or NeutronVLAN 2. Close management network for 1 Mongo node 3. Run OSTF tests """ self.env.revert_snapshot('ready_with_9_slaves') self.show_step(1) data = { 'ceilometer': True, 'tenant': 'failovergroup1', 'user': 'failovergroup1', 'password': 'failovergroup1', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings=data ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['mongo'], 'slave-05': ['mongo'], 'slave-06': ['mongo'], 'slave-07': ['compute'], 'slave-08': ['cinder'], } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(2) # TODO n_mongo = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles(['mongo']) with self.fuel_web.get_ssh_for_node(n_mongo[0]['name']) as remote: cmd = ('iptables -I INPUT -i br-mgmt -j DROP && ' 'iptables -I OUTPUT -o br-mgmt -j DROP') remote.check_call(cmd) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot('close_connections_for_mongo')

commit_message:
Add gate test for fuel web

Add gate test for python fuelweb  that should be executed
for each review in openstack/python-fuelweb repo.

Next variables should be exported:
UPDATE_FUEL=true
UPDATE_FUEL_PATH=/path/to/source

Test depends on empty,
so it is better to run it with -k option.
test_group: review_fuel_web_deploy
Scenario:
 1. Revert snapshot "empty"
 2. Apply changes into nailgun
 3. Get release id
 4. Update networks
 5. Bootstrap 3 nodes
 6. Create cluster
 7. Add 1 controller nodes
 8. Add 1 compute node
 9. Add 1 cinder node
 10. Deploy environment
 11. Run OSTF

Change-Id: I69ab8b657e996bec74333900f8a5e6d521c0743c

commit_message:
Add gnocchi for gate-ceilometer-dsvm-integration with oslo.messaging

I924f99ffb3344b2d501c53dbbc8403f419dfdee7 did not take into account
the oslo.messaging scenario, dropping openstack/gnocchi from PROJECTS
fails when gate-ceilometer-dsvm-integration is run in oslo.messaging
reviews.

Example: http://logs.openstack.org/65/261965/9/check/gate-ceilometer-dsvm-integration/a87bced/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2016-01-05_22_04_34_168

Change-Id: I42173cd721da582359f19a223bab5995b2458a55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/44/264144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update ceilometer proxy template

Now for using Ceilometer notifications from Swift we should
use Ceilometer middleware. Hence we need update template for Swift
to account for incoming and outgoing traffic notifications.

[1] I686e5d94fb72fd2a00973c91673edc417142ee2f
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/transport.html#oslo_messaging.TransportURL

Change-Id: Ib6efd4a1ab4b76c74cffc546383f5382c24a8c43
Related-bug: #1510064
(cherry picked from commit e8ad981eff0f97c24a53197c42caf350627d3c9f)

When StackResource 'update_with_template' is called and there
is no existing nested_stack, we call create_stack with an empty
template(TemplateResource CREATE_FAILED->UPDATE flow). We check
db for CREATE_COMPLETE before calling update_stack.There is a
possibility that the create_stack green thread has not finished
and released the stack lock. By persisting the stack state for

commit_message:
Fix action (CREATE) in progress error for TemplateResource/RG

When StackResource 'update_with_template' is called and there
is no existing nested_stack, we call create_stack with an empty
template(TemplateResource CREATE_FAILED->UPDATE flow). We check
db for CREATE_COMPLETE before calling update_stack.There is a
possibility that the create_stack green thread has not finished
and released the stack lock. By persisting the stack state for
COMPLETE/FAILED in the same db session as releasing the lock,
when green thread finishes it's run, we can avoid this race
condition.

Change-Id: I1442a7bcedb4fa340ee4f0e6ebc3705544c2a9dd
Closes-Bug: #1498495
(cherry picked and adopted from commit
e2294da861c24d538cafe1c54d038e2b5d4ba594)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/59/239659/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Callback function that will be passed to GreenThread.link(). Persist the stack state to COMPLETE and FAILED close to releasing the lock to avoid race condtitions. if stack is not None and stack.action not in ( stack.DELETE, stack.ROLLBACK): stack.persist_state_and_release_lock(lock.engine_id) else: lock.release(*args)
deleted_lines: Callback function that will be passed to GreenThread.link(). """ lock.release(*args)

* Install a development version of Ceph that is compatible with Manila's

commit_message:
Add Manila support for Ubuntu

Let the plugin setup and configure CephFS as the storage backend for
Manila. This is not done by default. Refer the README to do so.

Add 'pre_test_hook' and 'post_test_hook' scripts that would be needed
to configure Manila-Ceph CI jobs.

The following changes are also made:

* Install a development version of Ceph that is compatible with Manila's
  CephFSNative driver.

* The development version is a version greater than Infernalis. And
  from Infernalis onwards, the ceph daemons are run as user "ceph".
  So allow the daemons to run as user "ceph" for such versions.

* Enhance get_ceph_version to check Ceph version  even when the
  ceph mon daemon is not up, by checking the CLI version.

Co-Authored-By: John Spray <john.spray@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I74314bfcc6b52d524bb84f2232a988f275b9afbf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph refs/changes/02/258602/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set Manila related global variables used by Manila's DevStack plugin. if is_ceph_enabled_for_service manila; then ENABLED_SHARE_PROTOCOLS="CEPHFS" MANILA_DEFAULT_SHARE_TYPE=cephfstype MANILA_ENABLED_BACKENDS=cephfsnative1 MANILA_CONFIGURE_GROUPS=cephfsnative1 MANILA_OPTGROUP_cephfsnative1_share_driver=manila.share.drivers.cephfs.CephFSNativeDriver MANILA_OPTGROUP_cephfsnative1_driver_handles_share_servers=False MANILA_OPTGROUP_cephfsnative1_share_backend_name=CEPHFSNATIVE1 MANILA_OPTGROUP_cephfsnative1_cephfs_conf_path=${CEPH_CONF_FILE} MANILA_OPTGROUP_cephfsnative1_cephfs_auth_id=${MANILA_CEPH_USER} fi

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a"

Wrong usage of "a" in the mesages:
"lookup the instance after a instance_destroy_at_top hits"
"returns the PCI address of a an device"
"will result in a additional lookup to glance for said attr"
"This will ensure that a image is not deleted during the spawn"
"Lock to ensure that the spawn will not try and access a image"
"cleanup the _events_delayed dictionary when a event"
"it will raise a exception.NovaException"
"we need to allocate a ephemeral disk if required"
"this may be a endless loop, so check the id of"

Should be:
"lookup the instance after an instance_destroy_at_top hits"
"returns the PCI address of a device"
"will result in an additional lookup to glance for said attr"
"This will ensure that an image is not deleted during the spawn"
"Lock to ensure that the spawn will not try and access an image"
"cleanup the _events_delayed dictionary when an event"
"it will raise an exception.NovaException"
"we need to allocate an ephemeral disk if required"
"this may be an endless loop, so check the id of"

Totally 10 occasions in Nova base code.

Change-Id: I5d5d2d08ea2dbeba519adba73139061702233f7a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 08:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/nmanager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf/commit/7da3acf39ed56049274e49d47583091df30a0fc3', 'message': "Removed unnecessary parameter for flavor creation

We shouldn't use predefined Flavor ID in our OSTF tests, it will allow
to avoid any duplications of Flavor IDs in the future (because if we
will not specify Flavor ID it will be automatically generated like a
random hash with 32 characters.

Change-Id: Icfcd42270a7fd20b39da65e1c229a470ac0fc541
Closes-Bug: #1455451
"}]
commit_message:
Removed unnecessary parameter for flavor creation

We shouldn't use predefined Flavor ID in our OSTF tests, it will allow
to avoid any duplications of Flavor IDs in the future (because if we
will not specify Flavor ID it will be automatically generated like a
random hash with 32 characters.

Change-Id: Icfcd42270a7fd20b39da65e1c229a470ac0fc541
Closes-Bug: #1455451
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf refs/changes/91/224491/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use python-fuelclient instead of NailgunClient

Changes in review:
    Remove NailgunClient at all
    All methods from NailgunClient move to FuelWebClient for save
        backward compatibility with tests.
    FuelWebClient uses python-fuelclient for access to Fuel API
    Add python-fuelclient 6.1.3 into requirements

Change-Id: I9620ba6071dbeb5d6a204a8bf03dfb08f07037da
Implements: blueprint python-fuel-client-in-system-tests

commit_message:
Do not use notify for db-sync from main init class

If we want to use db-sync only on some node (for example, primary node)
and don't want run it on another we will get resource not found error
for notify in package ironic-common on db-sync.

Also db/sync class already contains all needed notifies on ironic-package
tag, so it also is duplicate.

Change-Id: I29939384bf96b82d9124307222a239b8aa95336b
Related-bug: #1529046
(cherry picked from commit efaf9daa1bf967927a37188525482c847be45015)

commit_message:
Support MongoDB as backend db

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/aodh/install/manual.html#mongodb
states that MongoDB is the recommended storage backend for Aodh,
adding support for it.

Change-Id: I3542d01e2b294506d6d311a3e996a5f9ed4b9953
(cherry picked from commit a0b22ffe0a408697a962087d77b9a203d6a017de)

commit_message:
Implement ::gnocchi::client

Create ::gnocchi::client class that takes care of python-gnocchiclient
package.

Change-Id: I1118f48fb5cbeaaa920035b1ba14767744c8a083
(cherry picked from commit 1d0ba66a12b4869adc90b293061a02254a015261)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-gnocchi refs/changes/51/263951/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'gnocchi::client' do shared_examples_for 'gnocchi client' do it { is_expected.to contain_class('gnocchi::params') } it 'installs gnocchi client package' do is_expected.to contain_package('python-gnocchiclient').with( :ensure => 'present', :name => 'python-gnocchiclient', :tag => 'openstack', ) end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian' } end it_configures 'gnocchi client' end context 'on RedHat platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end it_configures 'gnocchi client' end end

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add the ability to use python-pymysql library as backend for MySQL
connections.

Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.

Change-Id: Ia47aa99ade73ae63da0e00e32a4f87cefaaa9bda
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
(cherry picked from commit b3667a28e570e3889bb5a8a3859808dd3ca88f30)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila refs/changes/55/263955/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: { :database_connection => 'mysql+pymysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila', it { is_expected.to contain_manila_config('database/connection').with_value('mysql+pymysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila').with_secret(true) } context 'with MySQL-python library as backend package' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'mysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila' } end it { is_expected.to contain_manila_config('database/connection').with_value('mysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila').with_secret(true) } end context 'with incorrect database_connection string' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'foo+pymysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila', } end it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /validate_re/ end context 'using pymysql driver' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'mysql+pymysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila' } end it { is_expected.to contain_package('manila-backend-package').with({ :ensure => 'present', :name => 'python-pymysql' }) } end context 'using pymysql driver' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'mysql+pymysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila' } end it { is_expected.not_to contain_package('manila-backend-package') } end

commit_message:
Fix ::gnocchi::statsd class parameters documentation

Change-Id: Ia788b460818744059fd861b4922aebce0a086736
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9005f63e2345bbd1e706932a0e85b487d7cd4039)

commit_message:
tests: fix resource history test

Recent bug fix in Gnocchi avoid generating a useless revision when only
changing metrics in a resource. This makes this test fails. Let's fix it by
doing an actual change to the resource that will create an history record.

Change-Id: I8c89fad1dc71dc4324297e02a177f6913a4581bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-gnocchiclient refs/changes/23/264123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time # UPDATE to create a new revision self.gnocchi( 'resource', params=("update -t generic %s " "-a ended_at:%d" % (self.RESOURCE_ID, time.time()))) self.assertEqual(self.PROJECT_ID, resource_history[0]["project_id"])

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add the ability to use python-pymysql library as backend for MySQL
connections.

Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.

Change-Id: Id27afb52428a50ec889e8ae77f3509e1ca956538
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
(cherry picked from commit f70d5d5f31685bccc7e1f8bca9a63ea43ccb3251)

commit_message:
Remove Horizon django-openstack-auth lower pin

The lower pin for django-openstack-auth is no longer required.
Having the lower cap expressed in our requirements overrides the
Horizon project's own requirements and the upper constraints file,
resulting in the incorrect requirements being built in the repo.

Change-Id: Id9d483e1196ce733961ffb0164e078df198abc6d
(cherry picked from commit 229b67c4046e44dcd6ce362c9d673ab9c749e5d8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/52/260152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - django-openstack-auth
deleted_lines: # This lower cap is to address django openstack auth issues found here: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1497679 # If the Horizon requirements change to a later version, this may be removed. - "django-openstack-auth>=2.0.1"

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library
as backend for MySQL connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
The same implementation as it's done for keystone:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242134/

Change-Id: Ibc5b9717d681d9a090777d4fe64b906c3c07ec5d
(cherry picked from commit f813a16a6999a300760ceb3939f90d9f683e6d69)

commit_message:
[WIP] Fix requirements.txt for CentOS7

Requirements should be updated to match packages versions
available in CentOS7.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Is NOT compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: Ia6cf8d1f3b50ee1ecb1c7e9febc46193b799c889

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library as backend for MySQL
connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.

Change-Id: I75045bc44aa05e46b4ce1f4cc65b3080bd98704a
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
(cherry picked from commit 4f86d5d685464e4196d7db25e391914cbcd2a9b7)

commit_message:
Fix centos-source trove image building

It appears Trove still depends on MySQL-python.
Restore the workaround for broken Percona repo.

Closes-Bug: #1531371
Related-Bug: #1526129
Change-Id: I1781fee14e17a6b7cbb2cf8dae639e049698b9e6

commit_message:
Add ability for user to set "critical" flag on roles

Add "is_critical" field to role object. So now, user can control "critical"
state of roles via API and CLI.

Change-Id: I5ad20c0ec7046be581a8e354b03ba8bd29b08052
Closes-Bug: 1484985

commit_message:
Install mistral (workflow) in the undercloud

OpenStack has a workflow service so provide the
option to use it for some things.

commit_message:
[WIP] CentOS 7 support

There is a new patchset replacing current one - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246518

I won't abandon current patchset until 246518 is merged, because we use current when building custom ISO.

Change-Id: Ib476f7b5f63cf37e44ff87bb567d8a236cc946fa

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library
as backend for MySQL connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
The same implementation as it's done for keystone:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242134/

commit_message:
Document installing the undercloud with SSL endpoints

Adds a new admonition that covers how to install the undercloud
with ssl endpoints.  I would anticipate the admonition being
reused for the overcloud when that is documented.

Also covers how to generate a self-signed certificate appropriate
for use with HAProxy.

Change-Id: Iec58f79b83db6cbb684ff309b818d1a8f437dfa1

commit_message:
Enable loadbalancer with ssl on undercloud

When an ssl certificate is configured, configures haproxy with said
certificate in front of the public API endpoints for the services.
If no certificate is configured, leaves everything setup as before.

Change-Id: Idd9492303e797f5b39c980772f33754fb44a9f12

Add tox env for validate_tags script

This way the script can be run as:

$tox -e validate

Change-Id: Ia90bd02ab2e20dd99d613f91c9cd6b92eb9d94d8

commit_message:
Gen the image dependency in the Graphviz dot format

By using

    ./tools/build.py --save-dependency a.dot

to gen the Graphviz dot dependency file. Later, you can use the `dot`
to draw the picture.

    dot -Tjpg -o a.jpg a.dot

Implements: blueprint images-dependency-tree
Depends-On: I8e07a1b69fab5f1c587470bfd2104aaba93f0050
Change-Id: If00f4f3fb9d0b10a07ab2abb7ffb1cd9d64902f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/29/252929/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import graphviz parser.add_argument('--save-dependency', metavar='DEPENDENCY_FILE', help=('Path to the file to store the docker ' 'image dependency in Graphiz dot format'), type=str), def save_dependency(self, to_file): dot = graphviz.Digraph(comment='Docker Images Dependency') dot.body.extend(['rankdir=RL']) for image in self.images: dot.node(image['name']) if image['parent'] is not None: dot.edge(image['name'], image['parent']['name']) with open(to_file, 'w') as f: f.write(dot.source) if config['save_dependency']: kolla.save_dependency(config['save_dependency']) LOG.info('Docker images dependency is saved in {}'.format( config['save_dependency'])) return

commit_message:
Add Cinder's python-brick-cinderclient-ext library to cinder

a subproject of Cinder

commit_message:
[WIP] Add the neutron-classifier project

Neutron currently has a number of packet classifiers sprinkled
throughout the main repo and sub-projects. For example, there is traffic
classification in the Quality of Service API extension, the Security
Group API extension, the LBaas API extension, the FwaaS extension, the
Service Function chaining project, to list just a few.

Many of these projects have created their own data models to classify
network traffic, and most are classifying the same attributes of a
TCP/IP packet. Instead of having multiple implementations, a new library
can be developed that can be consumed by any project that wishes to do
traffic classification.

Change-Id: I97778f7ea6e8151602cf44c1523f14e2b4a98767

by passing an exception object as the first argument[1].

commit_message:
Use separate queue for agent state reports.

This optimization is needed for big clusters with hundreds
of agents where the spike of activity may trigger a burst
of RPC requests that would prevent neutron-server from processing
agent heart beats in time, triggering resource rescheduling.

This will be further optimized by running dedicated RPC workers
for state reports processing.

Related-Bug: #1496410
(cherry picked from commit 7267d75fdd3f90af759d71e9490cd41d41ba6d98)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py
	neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Change-Id: Id86a1f962aaa4f64011d57ae55d240f890cca4f7

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I9a99477f3f41884e86c984ffde9f46498953e933
Closes-Bug: #1530742

subject: Fix race conditions in migration 061
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-31 15:30:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/061_add_snapshot_id_timestamp_to_backups.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8b3ca76b980f126912de1bc8ffa067c199693eb3', 'message': "Fix race conditions in migration 061

Migration 061 is supposed to add new `data_timestamp` field and populate
it with value of `created_at` column. This was done by selecting all the
backups and doing updates one-by-one. As it wasn't done in transaction
solution was prone to race condition when a new backup is added while
running the migration. This means that this migration could cause
problems when running in live environment. With blueprint
online-schema-upgrades we want to make Cinder able to perform migrations
live.

A solution is to change this statement to a single DB query which
updates all the rows. This commit also removes unnecessary update to
snapshot_id added there. As this column is nullable it will by default
be NULL, so there's no need to set it manually to that value.

As before and after this commit the migration does logically the same,
this should be safe even if someone is doing inter-release deployments.

An alternative would be to simply add transaction to the update step in
the migration, but that would effectively lock the table for longer
period of time than atomic one-query update.

Closes-Bug: 1530358
Change-Id: Ib8733c096a3dbe2bad00beaf5734936ffcddda33
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race conditions in migration 061

Migration 061 is supposed to add new `data_timestamp` field and populate
it with value of `created_at` column. This was done by selecting all the
backups and doing updates one-by-one. As it wasn't done in transaction
solution was prone to race condition when a new backup is added while
running the migration. This means that this migration could cause
problems when running in live environment. With blueprint
online-schema-upgrades we want to make Cinder able to perform migrations
live.

A solution is to change this statement to a single DB query which
updates all the rows. This commit also removes unnecessary update to
snapshot_id added there. As this column is nullable it will by default
be NULL, so there's no need to set it manually to that value.

As before and after this commit the migration does logically the same,
this should be safe even if someone is doing inter-release deployments.

An alternative would be to simply add transaction to the update step in
the migration, but that would effectively lock the table for longer
period of time than atomic one-query update.

Closes-Bug: 1530358
Change-Id: Ib8733c096a3dbe2bad00beaf5734936ffcddda33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/06/262806/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: backups.update().values(data_timestamp=backups.c.created_at).execute()
deleted_lines: backups.update().values(snapshot_id=None).execute() backups.update().values(data_timestamp=None).execute() # Copy existing created_at timestamp to data_timestamp # in the backups table. backups_list = list(backups.select().execute()) for backup in backups_list: backup_id = backup.id backups.update().\ where(backups.c.id == backup_id).\ values(data_timestamp=backup.created_at).execute()

commit_message:
Update README to reflect pod model migration

One AZ(availability zone) can have multiple pods, but one pod will
belong to only one AZ. Tricircle will serve as the OpenStack API
gateway to bottom pods.

BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/implement-stateless

Change-Id: Ie7fc4faaa5ae4ca7c0e0153e993ea3f9f0cc252b
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/89/263989/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tricircle is an OpenStack project that aims to deal with multiple OpenStack deployment across multiple data centers. It provides users a single management view by having only one Tricircle instance on behalf of all the involved OpenStack instances. Tricircle is one big region to the end user in KeyStone.And each OpenStack instance , which is called a pod, is a sub-region of Tricircle in KeyStone, and not visible to end user directly. Tricircle acts as OpenStack API gateway, can accept all OpenStack API call and forward the API call to regarding OpenStack instance(pod), and deal with cross pod networking automaticly. The end user can see avaialbility zone (AZ in short) and use AZ to provision VM, Volume, even Network through Tricircle. Similar as AWS, one AZ can includes many pods, and a tenant's resources will be bound to specific pods automaticly.Free software: Apache license Design documentation: [Tricircle Design Blueprint](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18kZZ1snMOCD9IQvUKI5NVDzSASpw-QKj7l2zNqMEd3g/) Wiki:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/tricircle Documentation: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tricircle Source: https://github.com/openstack/tricircle Bugs: http://bugs.launchpad.net/tricircle Blueprints: https://launchpad.net/tricirclevalue is "RegionOne", we use it as the region for top OpenStack(Tricircle); "Pod1" is the region set via "POD_REGION_NAME", new configuration option introduced by Tricircle, we use it as the bottom OpenStack. - 6 Create pod instances for Tricircle and bottom OpenStackPay attention to "pod_name" parameter we specify when creating pod. Pod nameby Tricircle to route API request. In the above commands, we create pods named "RegionOne" and "Pod1" for top OpenStack(Tricircle) and bottom OpenStack. Tricircle API service will automatically create a aggregate when user creates a bottom site, so command "nova aggregate-list" will show the following result:glance image-list
deleted_lines: Tricircle is a OpenStack project that aims to deal with OpenStack deployment across multiple sites. It essentially serves as a communication bus between the central OpenStack instance and the other OpenStack instances that are called upon.- Project status, bugs, and blueprints are tracked on [Launchpad](https://launchpad.net/tricircle) - Additional resources are linked from the project [Wiki](https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Tricircle) pagevalue is "RegionOne", we use it as the top OpenStack; "Pod1" is the region set via "POD_REGION_NAME", new configuration option introduced by Tricircle, we use it as the bottom OpenStack. - 6 Create site instances for both top and bottom OpenStackPay attention to "name" parameter we specify when creating site. Site nameby Tricircle to route API request. In the above commands, we create sites named "RegionOne" and "Pod1" for top OpenStack and bottom OpenStack. commit_message:
Replace assertEqual(arg, None) with assertIsNone(arg)

In python-swiftclient some test cases using asserEqual(arg, None)
instead of assertIsNone(arg).assertIsNone method provides clear error message.

Change-Id: I4d673ede0965408344325c9c234c5c4b1ae4146a
Closes-Bug: #1527556

commit_message:
Copy log files instead of moving them

Copying the log files leaves the most recent log files for the user
to see. This is mostly convenient after a single run (with options
-b -r 1).

Change-Id: I0a8e572bdcff208f08d9b1c021dfa06dddd732bb

deleted_lines: echo "Moving osbash and test log files into $dir." mv *.auto *.log *.xml "$dir" || rc=$?

subject: [WIP] Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 12:20:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/01a781f280cf6c3b1980a5a9b107b80ee2f3f6b3', 'message': 'Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
use of an external MongoDB database for Ceilometer/Aodh and
for a deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to
consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

TODO (in subsequent patches):
 - update the developer AIO docs
 - convert run-playbooks.sh into an Ansible playbook

Back-port Note:
While this backport respects the differences between the Master
branch and the Kilo branch, it also brings all the gating and
AIO related scripts into line with each other to ensure that all
methods and settings (where applicable) are the same.

The following differences from the Master patch are noted:
 - neutron_rpc_workers must be 0 for Kilo
 - the in-tree pip_install role is used (configured in
   tests/ansible.cfg) instead of the new independent role
 - Change I98bcb478e99e11956618b2327399e18471aab534 is included
 - Change I31f63a2998080c6fedab3af7c2b1bb1a987d8c08 is included
 - Change If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f is included

>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh
>------scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
>------scripts/scripts-library.sh

commit_message:
[WIP] Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

TODO (in subsequent patches):
 - update the RPC docs
 - convert run-playbooks.sh into an Ansible playbook

UpgradeImpact:
 - Ansible has been updated to v1.9.4-1
 - Secrets have moved out from user_variables.yml into
   user_secrets.yml

Backport Note:
While this backport respects the differences between the Master
branch and the Juno branch, it also brings all the gating and
AIO related scripts into line with each other to ensure that all
methods and settings (where applicable) are the same.

The following differences from the Master patch are noted:
 - neutron_rpc_workers must be 0 for Juno
 - the in-tree pip_install role is used (configured in
   tests/ansible.cfg) instead of the new independent role
 - Change I98bcb478e99e11956618b2327399e18471aab534 is included
 - Change I31f63a2998080c6fedab3af7c2b1bb1a987d8c08 is included
 - Change If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f is included
 - All references to Ceilometer & Aodh have been removed
 - All references to MongoDB have been removed
 - In Juno there is no env.d directory, so all tasks related to
   it have been removed

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh
>------scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh
>------scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
>------scripts/scripts-library.sh

Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

(cherry picked from commit 892c7fe46c68bc36e76f21a6b699349167534f46)

commit_message:
Correct SecurityError with unicode args

_build_message() in the Error class has a bunch of code to handle
UnicodeDecodeError when doing message formatting. SecurityError
is a subclass of Error and overrides _build_message() but wasn't
handling UnicodeDecodeError. SecurityError's _build_message()
should work the same way as Error's.

Change-Id: I1ba1f1a1f3a211e805260817ba76f9e7bb6c0c4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/64/248464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _format_with_unicode_kwargs(msg_format, kwargs): try: return msg_format % kwargs except UnicodeDecodeError: try: kwargs = {k: encodeutils.safe_decode(v) for k, v in kwargs.items()} except UnicodeDecodeError: # NOTE(jamielennox): This is the complete failure case # at least by showing the template we have some idea # of where the error is coming from return msg_format return msg_format % kwargs if message: return message return _format_with_unicode_kwargs(self.message_format, kwargs) message = _format_with_unicode_kwargs(message, kwargs) return _format_with_unicode_kwargs(self.message_format, kwargs)
deleted_lines: if not message: try: message = self.message_format % kwargs except UnicodeDecodeError: try: kwargs = {k: encodeutils.safe_decode(v) for k, v in kwargs.items()} except UnicodeDecodeError: # NOTE(jamielennox): This is the complete failure case # at least by showing the template we have some idea # of where the error is coming from message = self.message_format else: message = self.message_format % kwargs return message message = message % kwargs else: return self.message_format % kwargs

commit_message:
Config option for insecure responses

oslo.log's "debug" option was co-opted to also indicate that the
responses should include more information. A separate config
option should be used instead so that deployers don't mistakenly
expose themselves to security issues.

The debug option still is used for what it does in oslo.log and
how it works on all other projects -- if you're not using a log
config file it sets the base logger to debug.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Icf8dd2f0b88abc89092d487bbcefb525960c4ec6
Closes-Bug: 1479523

commit_message:
Align template defaults with the client

This aligns the parameter default values from python-tripleoclient
with tripleo-heat-templates. This is in preparation for removing
all the defaults from the client, and maintaining them only in the
templates.

Change-Id: I7b635a250f1ecc170e18d8e434f0118c6fcbb942
Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/41/257541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
zuul/layout: disable puppet-tuskar jobs

puppet-tuskar is not supported anymore in master, because TripleO team
decided to give up Tuskar for some reasons.
Puppet groups wants to stop maintaining master while we will maintain
stable/* branches if needed.

This patch create noop jobs so we can still merge patches in stable
branches if needed.

Change-Id: I1238a5a16aaf376277a7fbebc027d42fc106d100
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/23/263923/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
net-bagpipe: remove now unneeded -liberty jobs

This change removes the -liberty jobs for networking-bgpvpn.

These are now un-needed since our master targets the openstack master
for mitaka, and we now have a specific stable/liberty branch targetting
liberty.

Change-Id: Ia9c009147fe5e22c9f5b48c311e83638a898e108

commit_message:
Remove useless Meta-Action

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher objects
and components by every contributor.

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

Change-Id: Ie0e33562f5e990c264a50ab3f533cfa62eac1d19

Allow mariadb role to pull images

Change-Id: I9b453545126e9030406c9888a8210b254ebd3637

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/56/263856/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - include: "{{ action }}.yml"
deleted_lines: - include: config.yml - include: bootstrap.yml - include: start.yml # We use register as a test to see whether the database is active and ready to # communicate. This run on all hosts that have a database and attempts to talk # to the local database rather than the vip, - include: register.yml # This will restart the container we initially used to bootstrap the cluster to # make it match the other containers environment-wise. This also prevents a # change from showing up when rerunning the playbooks - include: start.yml # Since the last start.yml may have recreated some containers we must wait and # check the health again to ensure the hosts are active. - include: register.yml

commit_message:
Align parameter defaults with the python tripleo client defaults

This aligns the tripleo-heat-template parameter default values with
those used by the python tripleoclient at
https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/constants.py
python-rdomanager-oscplugin with tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I3cdb088e35c3dbceb11153134d9c0992083a7465
Closes-Bug: 1529800

commit_message:
Remove support for Fedora 21 (EOL); add F22 where appropriate

Fedora 21 reached its End Of Life (EOL) on 1-DEC-2015[1]; remove it as
supported distribution.

    - stack.sh: Remove Fedora 21 from list of supported distributions.
    - tools/fixup_stuff.sh: Make the minimum Fedora version to be F22 in
      from a conditional check in 'Python packages' section
    - files/rpms/general: Remove 'f21' from NOPRIME.
    - lib/ceph: Remove 'f21' from the check_os_support_ceph() function.
    - doc/source/index.rst: s/Fedora 21/Fedora 22/
    - pkg/elasticsearch.sh: Remove the 'if' conditional in the
      install_elasticsearch() function.

[1] https://fedoramagazine.org/fedora-21-end-life-december-1st/

Change-Id: Ifbcc3dd783ff2f362a464fbf4ca22f20cc2c658e

commit_message:
Use oslo_config PortOpt support

The oslo_config library provide PortOpt type to validate
the port of range now.

References:

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Iee3333b401877a310cb39332f8dfe474c2b614ea
Closes-bug: #1489059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral-extra refs/changes/13/260513/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a"

Wrong usage of "a" in the mesages:
"This condition is to test for a entry"
"Creating a image"
"Waits for a interface to reach a given status."

Should be:
"This condition is to test for an entry"
"Creating an image"
"Waits for an interface to reach a given status."

Totally 3 occasions in Tempest base code.

Change-Id: I7c84ea3477bc02006a881981db77fdcf1f61a935

commit_message:
WIP: Enable terminology translation and comment

This is a sample to show the terminologies format.

doc/source/terminology.rst is a sample of terminologies.
You could see the terms and the comments.
(Comments are in Japanese now, we should translate them into English in
the final version.)
By running tox -e pot, pot files will be generated in doc/locale folder.
Please notice the comments are not included in the terminology.pot.

You could run tox -e docs to see the generated HTML file.

If we agree with the format, more actions need to be taken:
Enable the auto translation of i18n repo
Translators translate terminology.pot
Manually pack terminology.pot and its translation po files
and upload to Zanata ( the first msgid in terminlogy.pot should be removed
before uploading )

Change-Id: I6e66040f189b2d92a8c235a4fcb45dcc1592a854

commit_message:
Do not use __builtin__ in python3

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3, use
six.moves.builtins instead.

Change-Id: Idcaa582190fbb655f7e3e965a3a165137bdd9e3c
Closes-Bug: #1290234

[Scenario] New output format schema

This patch adds schema for new scenario output format
and switches code to usage of this schema.

Change-Id: Iab31b0f55bccfa1ab1f650a42f68bf2cad67707c
Implements: spec improve_scenario_output_format.rst

commit_message:
[Reports] Add charts classes for new output format

There are a set of classes added that will be in use
in further patches to process output data in new format.

These classes are:
  * OutputChart - base class for output-related charts
  * OutputStackedAreaChart - data is shown as Stacked Area
  * OutputAvgChart - average values shown as Pie
  * OutputStatsTable - makes generic statistics table

Existent class OutputStackedAreaChart is renamed
to OutputStackedAreaDeprecatedChart to avoid name conflict
with new class. Proper NOTE is added.

Also proporty Table.COLUMNS is renamed to lowercase.

Change-Id: I5cc4f34502fe308b775fdefa5d1bd90131b4d26b
Implements: spec improve_scenario_output_format.rst

42}) self.assertIsInstance(chart, charts.OutputChart) class OutputAvgChartTestCase(test.TestCase): def test___init__(self): self.assertEqual("Pie", charts.OutputAvgChart.WIDGET) chart = charts.OutputAvgChart({"iterations_count": 42}) self.assertIsInstance(chart, charts.OutputChart) self.assertIsInstance(chart, charts.AvgChart) @ddt.ddt class OutputStatsTableTestCase(test.TestCase): "Count"], charts.OutputStatsTable.COLUMNS) table = charts.OutputStatsTable({"iterations_count": 42}) self.assertIsInstance(table, charts.Table) @ddt.data( {"title": "Foo title", "iterations": [], 22.0, 23.6, 23.8, 24.0, 9.467, 3]]}) @ddt.unpack def test_add_iteration_and_render(self, title, iterations, expected): table = charts.OutputStatsTable({"iterations_count": len(iterations)}, commit_message:
Fix unable to create directory for nanomsg

When deploy devstack multiple times, it throws such an exception:

mkdir /opt/stack/nanomsg
mkdir: cannot create directory '/opt/stack/nanomsg': File exists

We check if the directory exists first.

Change-Id: I8b30657e397776588c28b6a2d394ad21c1b29b53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/54/263654/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mkdir -p $DEST/nanomsg

commit_message:
Fix description for "Inapt spelling of a word"

Change the description to "There is a inapt spelling
in the file called nova/doc/source/v2/2.0_general_info.rst.
  line5:...API is defined as a ReSTful HTTP service...
  line39:-  ReSTful web services
The word 'ReSTful' should be spelled as 'RESTful'.

Change-Id: Ic71c4d5df42b0b6182140684d0eb3c23a56aa142
Closes-Bug: #1489283

commit_message:
Remove the horrible catch-all during consumption

It is finally safe to remove the horrible catch-all logic during host
state consumption because all kinds of consumptions are correctly
handled :)

The final step will be make claim code reusable to remove all the
those duplicated claims in HostState.

Change-Id: I8a408a5e223d65a8f804749884055351f49bd766
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking

commit_message:
Claim pci in scheduler host state

Modify HostState.consume_from_instance to claim pci and check whether it
is consumable in the selected host. The related exception will be raised
with reasons. Scheduler can thus detect whether the pci request will
potentially trigger retry in the compute node, and prevent this from
happening to avoid the according expensive retry.

Note that this implementation is not the same with claim code in compute
service, because HostState.pci_stats does not track device objects. But
the claim logic is similar using `PciDeviceStats.support_requests` to
test resources. The following refactoring work can thus be easier.

Change-Id: Ifb91b29531d30bb4010b9064177e35e56e1e8584
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/262936/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Claim pci # TODO(Yingxin): Remove this code block once claim logic is reused instance_cells = None if claimed_numa_topology: instance_cells = claimed_numa_topology.cells if pci_requests: if not self.pci_stats.support_requests(pci_requests, instance_cells): reasons.append(_("Claim pci failed.")) # Consume pci if pci_requests:
deleted_lines: if pci_requests: instance_cells = None if spec_obj.numa_topology: instance_cells = spec_obj.numa_topology.cells

commit_message:
Claim numa topology in scheduler host state

Modify HostState.consume_from_instance to claim numa topology and check
whether it is consumable in the selected host. The related exception
will be raised with reasons. Scheduler can thus detect whether the
request's numa topology will potentially trigger retry in the compute
node, and prevent this from happening to avoid the according expensive
retry.

Note that this implementation is based on claim logic in compute
service. The code looks similar so that the following refactoring work
can be easier. And there will be another patch to implement pci claim.

Change-Id: I31513ef328a7e4f22ce9345576ef7f325de9c8b9
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/262935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pci_requests = spec_obj.pci_requests if pci_requests and self.pci_stats: pci_requests = pci_requests.requests else: pci_requests = None # Claim numa topology # TODO(Yingxin): This code block is mostly duplicated from claim logic, # aiming to merge claim logic more easily, remove this after # refactoring. host_topology, _fmt = hardware.host_topology_and_format_from_host( self) requested_topology = spec_obj.numa_topology claimed_numa_topology = None if host_topology and requested_topology: pci_stats = None if pci_requests: pci_stats = self.pci_stats claimed_numa_topology = hardware.numa_fit_instance_to_host( host_topology, requested_topology, limits=self.limits.get('numa_topology'), pci_requests=pci_requests, pci_stats=pci_stats) if not claimed_numa_topology: if pci_requests: reasons.append(_("Requested instance NUMA topology" " together with requested PCI devices" " cannot fit the given host NUMA" " topology")) else: reasons.append(_("Requested instance NUMA topology cannot" " fit the given host NUMA topology")) # Consume numa topology spec_obj.numa_topology = claimed_numa_topology self.numa_topology = hardware.get_host_numa_usage_from_instance( self, spec_obj)
deleted_lines: pci_requests = spec_obj.pci_requests if pci_requests and self.pci_stats: pci_requests = pci_requests.requests else: pci_requests = None # Calculate the numa usage host_numa_topology, _fmt = hardware.host_topology_and_format_from_host( self) instance_numa_topology = spec_obj.numa_topology spec_obj.numa_topology = hardware.numa_fit_instance_to_host( host_numa_topology, instance_numa_topology, limits=self.limits.get('numa_topology'), pci_requests=pci_requests, pci_stats=self.pci_stats) # NOTE(sbauza): Yeah, that's crap. We should get rid of all of those # NUMA helpers because now we're 100% sure that spec_obj.numa_topology # is an InstanceNUMATopology object. Unfortunately, since # HostState.host_numa_topology is still limbo between an NUMATopology # object (when updated by consume_from_request), a ComputeNode object # (when updated by update_from_compute_node), we need to keep the call # to get_host_numa_usage_from_instance until it's fixed (and use a # temporary orphaned Instance object as a proxy) instance = objects.Instance(numa_topology=spec_obj.numa_topology) self.numa_topology = hardware.get_host_numa_usage_from_instance( self, instance)

subject: Handle claim failure in FilterScheduler._schedule

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 08:42:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/53757ab6fe901b324fb0e3aa98de66a321c26eec', 'message': 'Handle claim failure in FilterScheduler._schedule

This change ensures that no resources are consumed in the host state if
any of the claims in `HostState.consume_from_request()` fails, and the
scheduler will change to try the second best host. This process is
identical to the claim logic in the compute nodes, so that some host
failing conditions in the compute nodes can be detected as soon as
possible to prevent some expensive retries. Note that the previous
implemented locks have already guaranteed that host states will not be
contaminated by concurrent host state updates amoung green threads.
Those locks will improve the scheduler decisions both in FilterScheduler
and CachedScheduler because of more accurate host state caches.

The following patchs will implement the claims for pci and numa
resources and merge compute node claim logics if possible.

Partially-implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

commit_message:
Handle claim failure in FilterScheduler._schedule

This change ensures that no resources are consumed in the host state if
any of the claims in `HostState.consume_from_request()` fails, and the
scheduler will change to try the second best host. This process is
identical to the claim logic in the compute nodes, so that some host
failing conditions in the compute nodes can be detected as soon as
possible to prevent some expensive retries. Note that the previous
implemented locks have already guaranteed that host states will not be
contaminated by concurrent host state updates amoung green threads.
Those locks will improve the scheduler decisions both in FilterScheduler
and CachedScheduler because of more accurate host state caches.

The following patches will implement the claims for pci and numa
resources and merge compute node claim logics if possible.

Change-Id: I3759233a56d28f7153ee8c2f00a60ad22fe94e78
Partially-implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

added_lines: def test_schedule_with_failed_consumption(self, mock_get_extra, mock_cn_get_all, mock_get_by_binary, mock_get_inst_info): """Make sure that scheduler will choose the appropriate host even if the claim of the best one failed. """ # attach side effect to the best host's consume_from_request() def _fake_get_filtered_hosts(hosts, filter_properties, index): hosts = list(hosts) hosts[1].consume_from_request = \ mock.MagicMock(side_effect= exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable(reason="")) return hosts self.flags(scheduler_host_subset_size=1) self.stubs.Set(self.driver.host_manager, 'get_filtered_hosts', _fake_get_filtered_hosts) spec_obj = objects.RequestSpec( num_instances=1, project_id=1, os_type='Linux', uuid='fake-uuid', flavor=objects.Flavor(root_gb=512, memory_mb=512, ephemeral_gb=0, vcpus=1), pci_requests=None, numa_topology=None, instance_group=None) self.mox.ReplayAll() hosts = self.driver._schedule(self.context, spec_obj) # The consumption of the best node4 will fail thus the second best # node3 should be selected. self.assertEqual(len(hosts), 1) self.assertEqual("node3", hosts[0].obj.hypervisor_hostname) @mock.patch('nova.objects.ServiceList.get_by_binary', return_value=fakes.SERVICES) @mock.patch('nova.objects.InstanceList.get_by_host') @mock.patch('nova.objects.ComputeNodeList.get_all', return_value=fakes.COMPUTE_NODES) @mock.patch('nova.db.instance_extra_get_by_instance_uuid', return_value={'numa_topology': None, 'pci_requests': None})

commit_message:
Claim cpu ram and disk in scheduler host state

Modify HostState.consume_from_instance to check cpu, ram and disk
resouces using the identical logic with `nova.compute.claims.Claim`
If the resources are not enough, the related exception will be raised
with detailed reasons. Together with previous implemented host state
locks, the scheduler can detect potential retries as soon as possible.

The following patches will implement ComputeResourcesUnavailable
handling to do retries inside scheduler, and to claim pci and numa
resources.

Change-Id: I7f80dc0dc9e30d801300f1e71b84bea5d3c09bc6
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/259893/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.i18n import _, _LI, _LW @set_update_time_on_success # Claim resources # TODO(Yingxin): Reuse claim logic here LOG.info(_LI("Attempting claim: memory %(memory_mb)d MB, " "disk %(disk_mb)d MB, vcpus %(vcpus)d CPU"), {'memory_mb': ram_mb, 'disk_mb': disk_mb, 'vcpus': vcpus}) reasons = [] cpu_limit = self.limits.get('vcpu') if cpu_limit is not None: free = cpu_limit - self.vcpus_used if vcpus > free: reasons.append(_("Free vcpu %(free).02f VCPU < " "requested %(requested)d VCPU") % {'free': free, 'requested': vcpus}) ram_limit = self.limits.get('memory_mb') if ram_limit is not None: free = ram_limit - (self.total_usable_ram_mb - self.free_ram_mb) if ram_mb > free: reasons.append(_("Free memory %(free).02f MB < " "requested %(requested)d MB") % {'free': free, 'requested': ram_mb}) disk_limit = self.limits.get('disk_gb') if disk_limit is not None: free = disk_limit * 1024 - \ (self.total_usable_disk_gb * 1024 - self.free_disk_mb) if disk_mb > free: reasons.append(_("Free disk %(free).02f MB < " "requested %(requested)d MB") % {'free': free, 'requested': disk_mb}) if len(reasons) > 0: raise exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable(reason= "; ".join(reasons)) LOG.info(_LI('Claim successful, instance: %(uuid)s.') % {'uuid': spec_obj.instance_uuid}) # Consume resources

commit_message:
Define paste entrypoints

Define filter factories so other projects can reference them by name
and can take advantage of the python egg instead of referencing
by the direct path.

Change-Id: I8f2b409e35b44323ef1a4488de5964a0f1bd7cdc
Closes-Bug: 1500509

commit_message:
Add Content-Length to swift object upload header

Fail to upload object if swift proxy-server is deployed in apache 2.4.
This patch is to add Content-Length to swift object upload request header.

Change-Id: I3733cce227ed6784826779a7d5a3c9c0fa609ca8

subject: Add nopreempt support for active/standby
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-06 02:16:04.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/drivers/keepalived/jinja/test_jinja_cfg.py', 'octavia/amphorae/drivers/keepalived/jinja/templates/keepalived_base.template'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/13dec23c0894b430dc83adf93b26b60830b4ed30', 'message': 'Add nopreempt support for active/standby

This patch enables nopreempt for active/standby topology amphora.
This reduces the need to migrate the IP between the active and standby
amphora.  This is important for amphora that are using TLS offload.

When a MASTER amphora fails over to a BACKUP amphora the IP address
migrates to the BACKUP which becomes the new MASTER.
With this patch, should the original MASTER come back up, the IP will not
migrate back to the original MASTER until the BACKUP fails.
Current behavior is when the original MASTER comes back up the IP
will migrate back to it.

Change-Id: Ib9f5ecd92f37299c7ae5cbb607f4f9df9106409f
'}]
commit_message:
Add nopreempt support for active/standby

This patch enables nopreempt for active/standby topology amphora.
This reduces the need to migrate the IP between the active and standby
amphora.  This is important for amphora that are using TLS offload.

When a MASTER amphora fails over to a BACKUP amphora the IP address
migrates to the BACKUP which becomes the new MASTER.
With this patch, should the original MASTER come back up, the IP will not
migrate back to the original MASTER until the BACKUP fails.
Current behavior is when the original MASTER comes back up the IP
will migrate back to it.

Change-Id: Ib9f5ecd92f37299c7ae5cbb607f4f9df9106409f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/58/253858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nopreempt

commit_message:
remove unused update_dhcp_hostfile_with_text method

This method isn't used anywhere in the code. Having dead code in tree
makes it much harder to debug issues because there are so many garden
paths to wander down.

Change-Id: I1bda8c75c6f54ad01c2d39106798a9c828595862
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/259105/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implements base classes for functional tests

In the cross project workshop "Establishing key themes for the Mitaka
cycle" [1] during the Mitaka summit, one of the agreed point was to
implement functional tests for the client libraries. [2]

Later on, this will serve to improve our backward compatibility for
client libraries. See I72e4e9cfa0539f6b326a0296c065fa3cb754f8ae

In preparation to implement the functional tests for both v2 and v3
clients, this patch initializes the new directories and adds the base
test classes: V3ClientTestCase and V2ClientTestCase.

Each class instantiates its specific keystoneclient version via
os-client-config either based on a clouds.yaml config file or from the
environment variables.

[1] https://mitakadesignsummit.sched.org/event/edd78ade4c7c92581a7cabc26019a85a
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-crossproject-themes

Change-Id: Ia73d72d5f87051fb46d733782275b548874a1def

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from keystoneclient.auth.identity import v3 from keystoneclient import session from keystoneclient.v3 import client class BaseTestCase(testtools.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(BaseTestCase, self).setUp() auth = v3.Password(auth_url='https://localhost:5000/v3', user_id='admin', password='admin', project_id='admin') self.client = client.Client(session=session.Session(auth=auth))

commit_message:
oslo_messaging requires stop() before wait()

According to [1], the correct usage is to call stop() before wait().

[1] -
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: I930526add5bff312347cb9e41feee7cdcadf3895
Closes-Bug: #1531239
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/67/263867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def stop(self): if self._server: self._server.stop() self._server.wait() super(Service, self).stop()

commit_message:
Fix db error when running python34 unit tests

If tests for py27 is executed before py34 tests, then there is a chance
that py34 related tests may fail.The following patch fixes it.
Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:merged++topic:bug/1489059,n,z

TrivialFix

more clear messages in case of failure.

commit_message:
add graphviz library

The project kolla needs graphviz to generate the image dependency
tree.[0]

Is the library actively maintained?
===================================
Yes. It is a active project on github[1]. And the latest release at
Nov 13, 2015[2].

Is the library good code?
=========================
It's mostly covered by unit tests and PEP8 compatible.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
===================================
Yes. It is compatible with python2.6, python2.7, python3.3, python3.4
and python3.5.

Is the library license compatible?
==================================
Yes, it's licensed under MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
=========================================================
No. But it is easy to package.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
===================================================================
No, there is no library interacting with Graphviz in global requirements.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252929/
[1] https://github.com/xflr6/graphviz
[2] https://github.com/xflr6/graphviz/releases/tag/0.4.8

Change-Id: I8e07a1b69fab5f1c587470bfd2104aaba93f0050

commit_message:
libvirt: fix typo in test_init_host_migration_flags

VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLEDVIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC is not a valid flag.

Note - fixing this doesn't actually affect the test because we don't
parse the value in init_host(), we just check whether it contains the
VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC string.

Change-Id: If33c63c0c7a3397c2b80714049b509c5918bfdc2
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove name_id when creating volume with cache enabled

When image_volume_cache_enabled = True, Cinder will create
a cached image volume. But when creating this image volume,
the name_id is set to id of newly created volume, which causes
the image volume is unable to be created in the underlying storage
system.

This fix will remove the name_id so that volume.name can refer to
correct LUN on storage system

Also, a minor fix: passing volume.id to delete_volume since
it only accept volume id.

Change-Id: Ib47b189a525d8a9bd9026cc20f62542aede9c9d4
Closes-bug: 1528087

commit_message:
Delete test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup

After looking at the test and its scope, it seems like 100% of the
code it tests is owned by oslo.service. That library has its own tests,
is there value in keeping the test in Neutron?

Change-Id: I0d8a22cc8127e183c1f55790f4b04dea2d30d356
Closes-Bug: #1518921

commit_message:
New Preview Page Needs All Input Types

The new theme preview page is awesome, but its lacking some
fundamental input types.  These types are really only different
on webkit, but its nice to be able to preview them.

Closes-Bug: #1519432
Change-Id: Ib9695050a8850ff38e24a13ca20f3d34c8580f0b

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Ica2deb048cc6afc7acd4ffdc0fa521e23b079942
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
vNIC tagging

A cloud user boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected
to a private network, the other to the public Internet. There is
currently no direct way to tell which interface is which. This patch
proposes an optional virtual network interface tag that is set by the
user at boot time and is exposed in the metadata.

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Change-Id: I053ed08198ca80d70bf5d37313eb848e78395ccc

commit_message:
Use alembic upgrade function/command directly

Instead of implementing a similar version to what the
upgrade function does, just use it directly instead.

Change-Id: I61a3c9f09c6e0724f2b55951989171ef4aaafe0c

deleted_lines: from alembic import config as a_config from alembic import environment as a_env from alembic import script as a_script def _alembic_config(): return a_config.Config(path) script = a_script.ScriptDirectory.from_config(_alembic_config()) def upgrade(rev, context): return script._upgrade_revs(revision, rev) config = _alembic_config() with a_env.EnvironmentContext(config, script, fn=upgrade, as_sql=False, starting_rev=None, destination_rev=revision, tag=None) as context: context.configure(connection=connection) context.run_migrations()

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I89546c2c77b1a15659918be65e6ef73157f98b23

commit_message:
correct rpmlint errors

these are all tremendously minor changes, but they were necessary to
stop rpmlint from throwing errors (which prevents official fedora
package builds).

Change-Id: I1f08753887583a90e26435b5ad0d8f86d2b30992

commit_message:
Set cluster to correct status when scaling failed

Currently, cluster status will not be set to correct value when
resizing/scaling action failed for size limitation check failure.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I9de9a8684c8aa6ffeae9b5f7df9331e51eb168b3
Closes-Bug: #1530746

subject: SIGHUP missed by child daemon process
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 15:23:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/67aa74914859ca224da099b3a11f2eee70b9653f', 'message': "SIGHUP missed by child daemon process

This issue might be due to the service process missing the
SIGHUP. This is reproducible locally when we set 'max pending
signals' of the shell using ulimit to a low value, like 10.
`ulimit -i 10`
and running test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup 30 times or so.

This is just to test the runs and see the success rate for
'test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup' on the server which fails
intermittently. This issue will happen when there is heavy
load on the server and pending signals threshold is hit.
This patch introduces a temp fix. If the test passes
consistently, then the ulimit of 'max pending signals' of
the server has to be set to 'unlimited' permanently in the
configuration.
The hard coded delays can be reduced/tuned afterwards.

Change-Id: I10355057f1c539cc8dd688fe7874055ae8d8c795
Closes-Bug: #1518921
